paragraphs.text: One day a leopard swims across the sea to Sindi. He is hungry and he is looking for food. He runs into an old lighthouse. The people of Sindi do not want the leopard in their lighthouse. But what can they do? How can they catch the leopard?

Sindi is an island in East Africa. It has beautiful beaches with white sand. The sea is clear and blue. There are lovely trees and flowers in Sindi. There is also a small village with white houses. An old lighthouse stands near the village on the rocks by the sea. This lighthouse is empty now. Sometimes children from the village play in the lighthouse.

radio.question: 1.1 Where's Sindi?

options.label: Sindi is an island in West Africa.
Sindi is an island in East Africa.

radio.question: 1.2 What's Sindi like?'

options.label: It's beautiful with beaches and the sand is white.
It's ugly with no beaches and the sand is gray.

radio.question: 1.3 Where do children usually play?

options.label: Children usually play in the village.
Children usually play in the lighthouse.

paragraphs.text: Sindi lies about five hundred metres from the mainland of Africa. A lot of animals live on the mainland – monkeys, elephants, and leopards. One day a leopard swims across the sea to Sindi. The leopard is very hungry and he is looking for food. He swims quickly. He comes to the beach and gets out of the water. Then he walks along the road to the village.

radio.question: 2.1 How many meters does Sindi lie from the mainland (of Africa?)

options.label: Sindi lies about five thousand metres from the mainland of Africa.
Sindi lies about five hundred metres from the mainland of Africa.

radio.question: 2.2 What kind of animals live on the mainland?

options.label: The animals are: monkeys, snakes, and crocodiles.
The animals are: monkeys, elephants, and leopards.

radio.question: 2.3 Why is the leopard looking for food?

options.label: Because it's hungry.
Because it's angry.

radio.question: 2.4 Where does the leopard go after it gets out of the water?

options.label: He walks along the road to the lighthouse.
He walks along the road to the village.

paragraphs.text: There is a marketplace in the village. Many people with small children are shopping in the market. They are buying meat, vegetables, and fruit. Suddenly, the hungry leopard runs into the marketplace. The people see him. Children cry and men throw stones. Some of the stones hit the leopard. He runs out of the market.

radio.question: 3.1 Where does the leopard run?

options.label: The leopard runs into the marketplace.
The leopard runs into a house.

radio.question: 3.2 What are the people doing in the marketplace?

options.label: They are buying clothes, jewelry, and shoes.
They are buying meat, vegetables, and fruit.

radio.question: 3.3 What do the men do when they see the leopard coming?

options.label: Men celebrate.
Men throw stones.

radio.question: 3.4 Do the stones hit him?

options.label: Yes, they do.
No, they don't.

paragraphs.text: The leopard runs through the streets of the village. Behind him, the people are following and throwing stones. They are very angry. They do not want a leopard in their village. The leopard is very tired now. But where can he run? He sees a small road between two high walls. He turns and runs along this road. The people follow him.

radio.question: 4.1 Where does the leopard run through?

options.label: The leopard runs through the people of the village.
The leopard runs through the streets of the village.

radio.question: 4.2 Do the people want the leopard in their village?

options.label: No, they don't.
Yes, they do.

radio.question: 4.3 Can the leopard escape from the people?

options.label: Yes, it can.
No, it can't.

paragraphs.text: The leopard runs quickly along the road. He cannot see over the walls. He cannot go back and there is no way out. Suddenly, he sees a tall building. The door of this building is open. He runs through the door. Then, he stops. What now? The people are coming. He sees some stairs. He runs up the stairs – up into the building. The building is the old lighthouse.

radio.question: 5.1 Is there a way out for the leopard?

options.label: No, there isn't.
Yes, there is.

radio.question: 5.2 So, where does it go?

options.label: It goes into the water.
It goes into the old lighthouse.

paragraphs.text: Then, the people stop running. "What's happening"? they ask. "Where is the leopard?" Then, one man looks up at the lighthouse. "Look!" he says. "The leopard is in the lighthouse!" The people look up. They can see the leopard high up on the wall at the top of the lighthouse. The leopard looks down at the people. The people look up at the leopard.

radio.question: 6.1 Why do the people stop running?

options.label: Because the leopard is at the top of lighthouse.
Because the leopard is at the on the stairs.

paragraphs.text: The leopard stays in the lighthouse for three days and nights. He has no food or water, but he does not come down the stairs. "What now?" ask the people. "How can we get the leopard out of the lighthouse?" They talk and talk. But they do not go into the lighthouse. The people watch the leopard. The leopard watches the people. The people wait and the leopard waits.

radio.question: 7.1 How long does the leopard stay in the lighthouse?

options.label: The leopard stays in the lighthouse for four days and nights.
The leopard stays in the lighthouse for three days and nights.

radio.question: 7.2 Does it have food and water?

options.label: No, he doesn't.
Yes, he does

radio.title: Choose the correct answer.
radio.question: 7.3 Then, what do the people do?

options.label: They wait.
They go into the lighthouse.

paragraphs.text: The Head Man of Sindi is called Mohammed. Mohammed has a beautiful daughter, Tanza. "What can we do?" the people ask Mohammed. "The leopard is very hungry and can kill our children. We must catch him. But how?" Mohammed thinks. Then he says, "Let the men of Sindi have a competition. The competition is to kill the leopard. The winner can marry Tanza."

radio.question: 8.1 Who's the head of Sindi?

options.label: The Head Man of Sindi is called Tanza.
The Head Man of Sindi is called Mohammed.

radio.question: 8.2 What does he decide to do?

options.label: He decides to have a competition.
He decides to free the leopard.

radio.question: 8.3 Can the winner marry Tanza?

options.label: No, he can't.
Yes, he can.

paragraphs.text: Many men in Sindi are in love with Tanza. One man is called Ahmed. Ahmed has a big house and lots of animals, but he is old and Tanza does not like him. Ahmed has a gun. He brings the gun to the lighthouse. The leopard is high up on the walls of the lighthouse. Ahmed fires the gun. BANG! But the leopard does not fall off the wall. Tanza is very happy.

radio.question: 9.1 What does Ahmed have?

options.label: He has a small house and some animals.
He has a big house and lots of animals.

radio.question: 9.2 Does Tanza like him?

options.label: No, she doesn't.
Yes, she does.

radio.question: 9.3 Can Ahmed kill the leopard?

options.label: Yes, he can.
No, he can't.

paragraphs.text: There is a young man called Jamal. Jamal is big and strong. But he talks a lot and Tanza does not like him. Now Jamal says, "I can kill the leopard. I can kill him with my knife." He brings a goat and some rope to the lighthouse. The leopard is at the top of the lighthouse. Jamal ties the goat to the bottom of the stairs. Then, he waits.

radio.question: 10.1 Is Jamal short and weak?

options.label: Yes, he is. He's short and weak.
No, he isn't. He's big and strong.

radio.question: 10.2 Does Tanza like him?

options.label: Yes, she does.
No, she doesn't.

radio.question: 10.3 What does Jamal do with the goat?

options.label: He ties the goat to the bottom of the stairs.
He takes the goat up to the top of the lighthouse.

paragraphs.text: The leopard is very hungry. He can smell the goat. It smells good. At last, the leopard comes down the stairs. He sees the goat but he does not see Jamal. Now the goat can see the leopard. He pulls and pulls at the rope. The rope breaks and the goat runs away. The leopard turns and runs back up the stairs. Jamal is very angry but Tanza is happy.

radio.question: 11.1 Can the leopard eat the goat?

options.label: No, he can't.
Yes, he can.

radio.question: 11.2 What happens when the leopard comes down the stairs?

options.label: The goat goes up to the top of the lighthouse.
The rope breaks and the goat runs away.

paragraphs.text: "What now?" asks Mohammed. "Perhaps I can help," says a quiet young man. He has a gun but it is not like Ahmed's gun. He also has something in his hand. "What's that?" asks Mohammed. "It's a dart." says the young man. "I can shoot the dart into the leopard with the gun." "And then what happens?" asks Mohammed. "Watch," says the young man. He puts the dart into the gun.

radio.question: 12.1 Who's the next person who tries to catch the leopard?

options.label: Mohammed.
A young man.

radio.question: 12.1 Does he have a real gun?

options.label: No, he doesn't.
Yes, he does.

paragraphs.text: Tanza looks at the young man. He has nice eyes and a kind face. "What's your name?" she asks. "Saied," says the young man. He smiles at her. Tanza smiles, too. She likes him. The leopard is on the lighthouse wall. Said holds his gun and fires. POP! But nothing happens. The leopard does not fall off the wall. Ahmed and Jamal are laughing. "Wait," says Saied. Fifteen minutes pass.

radio.question: 13.1 What's Said like? [Como ele é?]

options.label: He has nice eyes and a kind face.
He has strange eyes and a mean face.

radio.question: 13.2 Does Tanza like him?

options.label: No, she doesn't.
Yes, she does.

radio.question: 13.3 Does Said shoot the leopard?

options.label: Yes, he does.
No, he doesn't.

paragraphs.text: "Look!" says Saied. "The leopard is falling. Come on!" He runs up the stairs and the people follow. "Is the leopard dead?" asks Tanza. "No," says Saied. "My dart doesn't kill animals. He is only sleeping." "Let's kill him now," shout the people. "No," says Saied. "The leopard is beautiful. Please give him to me." "All right," says Mohammed. "The leopard is yours, Saied."

radio.question: 14.1 Is the leopard dead?

options.label: Yes, he is.
No, it's not.

radio.question: 14.2 What happens to him?

options.label: The dart makes him sleep.
The dart makes him run away.

paragraphs.text: Saied takes the leopard to the Animal Park in Nairobi. Then he comes back to Sindi. Later, Tanza and Saied get married. Five years pass. They have children now – two boys and a girl. They are very happy. They often visit the Animal Park and sometimes the children see the leopard. "Tell us the story of the leopard and the lighthouse," say the children. And Saied tells them the story.

radio.question: 15.1 Where does Saied take the leopard?

options.label: Saied takes the leopard home.
Saied takes the leopard to the Animal Park in Nairobi.

radio.question: 15.1 What happens to Saied and Tanza?

options.label: Tanza and Saied become friends.
Tanza and Saied get married.

radio.question: 15.1 How many children do they have?

options.label: They have two boys and a girl.
They have two girls and a boy
